newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks up, two top issues sole losers.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks up, two top issues sole losers.

text.p: Croatian stocks continued to move up in livelier trade on Thursday, with fully-listed drugs firm Pliva and Zagrebacka Banka as sole decliners.
Eight out of 11 traded issues rose and one was flat.
But market participants predicted a steep rising trend that began in the new year would likely come to an end next week, with the market solidifying before prices start to firm again.
"We could see a slight stagnation and stabilisation next week," said Davor Relja, analyst at Faktor brokerage.
He said a new upward movement could be launched soon after Croatia gets a credit rating, widely expected be solid.
Stocks volume rose to 10,954 shares on Thursday and turnover was also up at 7.8 from Wednesday's 5.2 million kuna.
Top gainer was hotelier Istraturist, jumping 38 kuna or 26.76 percent to close at 180 kuna with 637 shares sold.
It was followed by Zagrebacka Banka E-series, gaining 70 kuna or 14 percent to 570 kuna on volume of 592 units.
Bigger of the two losers, Zagrebacka's ordinary stock, fell 22 kuna to 1,208, but it was the most active issue with 5,000 units sold.
Its decline was in line with a weaker price of the bank's 1/10 GDRs at $22.75/85 on Seaq in the morning.
The other blue chip, Pliva, edged down five kuna to 415 on volume of 1,231 shares. Pliva's GDRs also eased to $15.57/74 after hitting a $16.25 record in London on Wednesday.
